author: __kasey__
content:
question on deneb fork choice specs[1] 
`The block MUST NOT be considered valid until all valid Blobs have been downloaded`
- `on_block` has the line: `assert is_data_available(hash_tree_root(block), block.body.blob_kzg_commitments)`
- `is_data_available` has the following note `The implementation of is_data_available will become more sophisticated during later scaling upgrades`:
  - and this comment `Note: the p2p network does not guarantee sidecar retrieval outside of MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_BLOBS_SIDECARS_REQUESTS`

Consider a node processing deneb blocks that are older than `MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_BLOBS_SIDECARS_REQUESTS` -  in order for the assertion to not fail, should I assume that we'll eventually add something like this to `is_data_available`?:
```if get_current_slot(store) - signed_beacon_block.block.slot > (MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_BLOBS_SIDECARS_REQUESTS * SLOTS_PER_EPOCH):
    return true
```
[1] https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/deneb/fork-choice.md#is_data_available

author: inphi
content: Yes, you can forgo data availability, i.e. `is_data_available` is true, for deneb blocks that are older than `MIN_EPOCHS_FOR_BLOBS_SIDECARS_REQUESTS`
